plugins.name: Guide Mate
plugins.description:
Guide Mate is a Figma plugin which helps you add complex guides to your design with ease. A great companion for grid based design systems. 

Usage:
- Select a frame, group or shape.
- Open Guide Mate from the plugin menu.
- Click one of the icon in the shortcut panel on the top to add left, right, top, bottom or midpoint guides.
- Enter details in the form and click on "Add Guides" to generate custom guides.

More information can be found at https://github.com/praneshr/guidemate

Limitations:
- At least one frame or group or shape should be selected while using the plugin
- Multi selection is not supported. Instead, you can group the items and use the plugin
- Any selected items should be inside a frame. Page level guides are not supported yet.

Please report any bug in the provided support url.

plugins.name: AI Generated Avatars (free)
plugins.description:
Search through 1,800+ AI generated avatars


AI Generated Avatars let's you search through 1,800+ avatars that were generated (using ChatGPT and DALL·E 3). These avatars are perfect as placeholder images or placeholder graphics for your web design or app design project. Here are more details:


👋🏻 First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All avatars are available to use for your projects


👵 Filter by Age Group:

  1. Choose from 5 different age groups
  2. Useful if you're building products or designs for different age groups or demographics
  3. Currently includes the following age groups: 12 - 18, 19 - 25, 26 - 35, 36 - 50, 50+


💁‍♀️ Filter by Gender:

  1. Use this to find specific avatars for the use-case of your design
  2. Over 900+ avatars for the male and female genders
  3. Currently includes the following genders: Male, Female


🌴 Filter by Ethnic Group:

  1. Choose from 7 different ethnic groups (or ethnicities)
  2. Ideal for people building designs or pages for specific regions in the world
  3. Also great to ensure you're designs are more representative of the world
  4. Currently includes the following Ethnic Groups: Asian, Black, Hispanic, Indian, Middle Eastern, Native, White


🛝 Customize Grid Size:

  1. Change the grid size in the plugin from 1 to 5 avatars per row
  2. This helps you see the fidelity and resolution of the avatars


🤔 More:

  1. Drag and drop: just drag your avatar to the exact place in your Figma Design that you want it to go
  2. Click: click on any avatar to add it to the exact center of your design
  3. All avatars are added as the top most layer so you can easily find it
  4. All avatars are named with "AI Generated Avatars" and the name of that avatar (easy to find)


🔗 References:

  1. This wouldn't be possible without @timz: https://news.ycombinator.com/user?id=timz
  2. Here's where you can find more information on his project: https://avatars.tzador.com/


🛟 Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is


🎉🎉🎉

accepted.name: Berry
accepted.description:
Question, idea or feedback? 
support@berryplugins.com

plugins.tagline: Free access to over 1,800 AI generated avatars across ages, genders and ethnicities!

plugins.name: notely ✍️ | Sticky Notes
plugins.description:
Introducing Sticky & Post-It Notes for Your Figma Files.

Notely transforms note-taking within Figma, ensuring crucial insights and feedback are effortlessly captured and shared across teams. Tailored for designers, developers and stakeholders alike, notely simplifies collaboration by making notes easily accessible.


Features

✅ Seamlessly integrate notes between the UI and canvas

🔖 Quick Note Creation: Easily create, compile, and modify notes

⌨️ Quick Actions Support: for add, write, edit (ctrl+p)

📝 Custom Components: Personalize with your note designs

🔄 Simple Migration: Effortlessly switch from other note systems

🔍 Filter and search your notes

🖼️ Image Support: Add and manage images inside your notes

🔗 Link Management: Insert and manage clickable links with ease

✨ Import notes from Miro, Text2Note, Notely and Asana


🚀 Instant Setup & Migration

Open your file to integrate notely into your workflow instantly.

Easily migrate your existing notes and components by adopting the naming conventions from the playground.


✨ Stay Updated

Follow @RaikenStudio via Twitter/X for the latest notely news and updates.


⏲️ Coming Soon

plugins.name: LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode
plugins.description:
Streamline Your Development Workflow with LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode!

Unlock the full potential of your development process with LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode. This innovative feature bridges the gap between design and code, providing developers with the tools to translate Figma designs into functional, interactive animated elements seamlessly.


🚀 Developer-Centric Design Integration:

With LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode, developers can access animation asset URLs and embed codes directly from Figma. This streamlines the integration of Lottie animations into your projects, enhancing collaboration between designers and developers.


🌟 Core Features:

  • Efficient Collaboration: Access and copy Lottie animation asset URLs directly from your LottieFiles workspace within Figma.
  • Dev Mode Embedding: Auto-generate embed codes for web deployment in HTML Embed, oEmbed, and iFrame formats.
  • Format Flexibility: Choose between optimized dotLottie, Lottie JSON or optimized Lottie JSON formats for your Lottie animations.


🔧 How to Use LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode:

  1. Install the Plugin(s): Download both LottieFiles for Figma and LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode plugins.
  2. Insert Animations: Add animations to your Figma canvas from the LottieFiles workspace as a GIF or SVG.
  3. Activate Dev Mode: Enable Dev Mode in Figma and open the LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode plugin.
  4. Access & Implement: Click on the inserted Lottie animation to copy asset URLs, embed codes, and seamlessly integrate them into your code.


🌉 Bridging Design and Code:

LottieFiles for Figma Dev Mode is designed to facilitate a harmonious collaboration between designers and developers. It simplifies the process of turning intricate designs into interactive, web-ready animations, ensuring a more efficient and cohesive workflow.


💬 We Value Your Feedback:

Your insights and experiences are crucial to us. For any suggestions, questions, or support, reach out to us at support@lottiefiles.com.


Contact Us:

Instagram · YouTube · X (fka Twitter) · LinkedIn · Facebook


Learn more about the LottieFiles for Figma plugin at https://lottiefiles.com/plugins/figma.

accepted.name: LottieFiles
accepted.description: Great designs come alive with motion!

plugins.tagline: Copy, paste, and ship production-ready Lottie animations effortlessly

plugins.name: Image to Color Palette
plugins.description:
Transform your favorite images into design-ready palettes with a single click.


Here's how it works:


  1. Select an image. It could be anything - a moodboard, a picture that caught your eye, or even a screenshot.
  2. Run the Image to Color Palette plugin. The plugin will display the six most dominant colors in a pop-up.
  3. From there, you can copy individual colors or the whole palette directly to your canvas.


Note: Extracted colors may not match the exact hex codes in your original image.

accepted.description: building @ lowercase.club

plugins.name: Image Trim
plugins.description:
Got an image with extra pixels which takes time to remove?


No worries, we are here to help you. Use “Image Trim” to get rid of those extra pixels, which may be taking your time to remove them, or resize image, as well as it consuming bytes on your file, which ultimately takes more time to load your Figma file. But now no more frustrations. Use our single click plug-in and remove them.


Now we are also supporting to trim multiple images in single click, just select layers with images and run the plugin, rest will be handled by us.


Advantages of Image Trim

  • Saves your time to trim images with extra pixels.
  • Deletes those pixels, so basically reduces image storage size.
  • 100% safe, no extra pixels gets removed.
  • Trim multiple images in single click.


How to use

  1. Select any layer(s) with image
  2. Run “Image Trim” from the plug-in panel.
  3. And that’s it, you are done.
plugins.tagline: Get rid off those extra pixels and save your time, because TIME IS MONEY!!!

plugins.name: Perspective
plugins.description:
Perspective adds depth and dimension to your designs with easy-to-use perspective transformations and shadow effects.


🔄 Perspective Transformations

• Apply isometric, dimetric, and cabinet projections with a single click

• Fine-tune angles with precise controls

• Live preview as you adjust

• Swap and invert angles instantly


🎨 Shadow Effects

Four versatile styles to add depth:

1. Basic - Simple shadows that follow your element's colors

2. Complex - Full control over shadow color, direction, and darkness

3. Oblique - Clean black shadows for technical drawings

4. None - Remove all effects


✨ Features

• Intuitive controls for shadow direction and depth

• Color picker for custom shadow colors

• Light direction toggle

• Darkness control for shadow intensity

• Live preview of all changes

• Works with any Figma element that supports effects


Perfect for:

• Technical illustrations

• UI design

• Isometric icons

• Product mockups

• Architecture diagrams

• Game assets


Made with ❤️ by Square One

plugins.name: Prototyper
plugins.description:
Create game controller and keyboard navigation prototypes in seconds with Prototyper. Used and trusted by designers at PlayStation, Riot Games, Blizzard, Epic Games, Amazon, Microsoft and more.


Learn how to use Prototyper

In this Game UI Prototyping talk, learn how to build a Game Inventory, Skill Tree and Quest Log prototype in under 10 minutes with Prototyper.


Create a prototype from existing mockups (demo)

  1. Select all top-level frames of your mockups.
  2. In Prototyper, go to the Link tab.
  3. Click Link.


Create a prototype from a single mockup (demo)

  1. Create components for the UI elements you would like to navigate in your mockup. For each component, add a component property to change between an unfocused and focused visual state. Now replace the UI elements with instances of the components you just created.
  2. In the top-level frame of your mockup, select the component instances.
  3. In Prototyper, under Navigation Focus type the name of the component property that controls focus, and the values that represent the unfocused and focused states.
  4. Click Generate.


Prototype interactions will be automatically assigned based on how the selected elements are arranged. For example, mockups or elements arranged horizontally will be navigable with left and right inputs.


Privacy & Network Access

Prototyper is completely private. It runs locally in your file and does not make any network calls. All stats are also calculated and stored on your computer.


Open Source

Prototyper is open source and contributions are welcome!


Contributors

  1. Alex Tokmakchiev - PlayStation Controller Keycodes
  2. Antoine Plu - PlayStation Controller icons

accepted.name: Aashrey Sharma
accepted.description: Senior UX Designer @ Epic Games

plugins.tagline: Create game controller and keyboard navigation prototypes in seconds

plugins.description:
Export text layers to an Excel sheet, CSV, JSON and Clipboard with a single click.

  1. Export text layers from one or more selected frames & sections.
  2. Export only selected text layers.
  3. Copy selected text layer contents to Clipboard
  4. Remove duplicates and number layers before exporting.

Import (Beta) now available for Excel format.


🚀 How the plugin works?

Watch the Demo


🚀 How to import the content ?

Documentation | Watch the Demo


✴️ How to export the content as JSON with Layer Name?

For example, if you modify the names of the text layers in Figma to "btn-submit" and "text-welcome", the resulting JSON export would appear like this:


{
"btn-submit": "Submit",
"text-welcome" : "Welcome"
}


Watch the Demo

plugins.name: Masker
plugins.description:
Masker allows you to easily overlay devices on selected layers in your project.  First, select one or more layers in your design file, then choose from the Masker palette to apply.
We recommend that you select layers that match the actual size of the device. The best way to do this is with the devices built into Figma.

Choose from the following: 
— Iphone X
— Iphone 8 Plus
— Iphone 8
— Google Pixel 2
— Google Pixel 2 XL

How to use Masker. 
— For single layer selection: Select a layer in the project, then choose from the Maker palette to apply. If you have done everything correctly, the plugin will automatically select the device by size, if not, it will give you this choice.
— For multiple selections with a layer: select multiple layers in the project, then choose from the Maker palette to apply. If you have done everything correctly, the plugin will automatically calculate the number of selected layers and select the device by size, if not, then give you the choice.
— For select without a layer: open the Masker from the palette, and then select the desired device and the number of items. 
Minimum possible number: 1.
Maximum possible number: 49.
The maximum limit is made to optimize Figma's performance. Please contact us if you need a larger limit 🙂

IMPORTANT: When selecting a layer, make sure it does not have a device mask. Otherwise, an error will be displayed.

Ideas for the next version: 
— Possibility of filling the screen with color and background selection from the gallery.
— New devices such as watches, laptops, and desktops.
— Automatic mask matching for different layers. 

Any other ideas? Send them to us at dudeinhoodie@gmail.com

plugins.name: Spacer Toggle
plugins.description:
This is specifically built for designers using spacer components to replace padding in auto layout frames. Where show/hide removes the spacers entirely, opacity retains the layout, letting designers and developers show and hide spacer colors/labels as needed.


This plugin will only affect instances of component sets with "~spacer" included in the name. You must also create a variant property named "Visible" with "On" and "Off" values. Set "On" to 100% opacity and "Off" to 0% opacity.


Note: Names are case sensitive!


Hot tip: Mac users can bind the plugin to an App Shortcut in System Preferences for quick access. I like to use control + F (as it's right next to the grid shortcut).

accepted.name: Kylie LaCour
accepted.description: Enthusiast of elegant digital systems, dedicated advocate of fluid responsive design, and novice creator of plugins.

plugins.tagline: Quickly toggle the visibility of spacer component instances using opacity instead of show/hide.

44662.description:

44662.release_notes:
Changed to toggle only selected spacers rather than entire page. Dramatically increases performance if you have a lot of spacers.

Also fixed a bug where if you had some spacers on and some off, it would toggle both to the opposite states. Now, if some spacers are off, running the plugin will toggle everything on. If all spacers are on, it will toggle them off.

Rewrote parsing code to be more efficient.
44662.tagline: Quickly toggle the visibility of spacer component instances using opacity instead of show/hide.

plugins.name: Ampier Email Generator
plugins.description:
Video Tutorials

Documentation

Figma Playground


About

Introducing Ampier, your go-to Figma plugin for seamlessly transforming designs into clean, responsive HTML, and AMP email code. Ampier serves as both an email generator and builder, offering unparalleled functionality for crafting stunning email campaigns within the familiar Figma environment.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Code Generation: Generate clean and responsive HTML and AMP code effortlessly from your Figma designs.
  2. Dark Mode Precision: Ensure your emails look top-notch with previews for both regular and Gmail dark mode on iOS.
  3. Image Alt Attribute Customization: Specify alt attributes for images to enhance accessibility and user experience.
  4. Adaptive Stacking: Support for reverse blocks stacking, providing excellent mobile adaptation even for intricate block arrangements.
  5. Background Position Control: Customize background positions for a visually appealing design.
  6. Predefined Assets and Beautiful Packs: Access built-in assets for quick starts and explore beautiful asset packs for added creativity.
  7. Flexible Preheader Options: Set invisible or short preheaders for your emails to optimize user engagement.
  8. Versatile Export Options: Seamlessly export your code to popular ESPs like Mailchimp, Klaviyo, SendGrid and others.
  9. AMP for Email Technology: Harness the power of AMP to create dynamic feedback forms directly within your email messages.
  10. Fallback HTML Support: Define special HTML parts as fallbacks for clients that don't support AMP, ensuring broader compatibility.
  11. Device Preview and Screenshots: Preview your real email at different device sizes and capture quick screenshots to showcase your progress.
  12. Code Optimization: Ensure your emails stay below the 100KB limit with code compression and minification.
  13. AI Integration: Leverage AI for intelligent generation of images and text within your emails.


Support

For any inquiries, bug reports, or assistance, reach out to us directly at support@ampier.io. We're dedicated to resolving issues promptly and ensuring a smooth experience for our users.


Trial: Experience the power of Ampier with our trial offering - enjoy 5 free exports without the need for registration. For more information, visit our website or contact us directly.


Elevate your email marketing game with Ampier - where design meets functionality seamlessly.

accepted.name: Ampier
accepted.description: Email marketing. AMP technology

plugins.name: 背景擦除 Removebg
plugins.description:
Introduction:

Removebg Background Removal is a powerful and easy-to-use Figma plugin designed to help you quickly and efficiently remove backgrounds from images. Whether you are working with a single image or multiple images, this plugin allows you to cleanly isolate subjects with just one click.


Features:

  1. Single Image Background Removal: Select a single image and remove the background instantly with one click.
  2. Multiple Images Background Removal: Select multiple images and remove their backgrounds all at once.
  3. Language Support: The plugin supports multiple languages including English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean.
  4. Real-time Preview: View a preview of the background removal effect before applying it.
  5. Easy Integration: Integrate seamlessly into your Figma workflow.


Instructions:

  1. Install the Plugin: Install the Removebg Background Removal plugin from the Figma plugin library.
  2. Select Images: Select the image(s) you want to remove the background from.
  3. Choose the Mode: Switch between “Single Image” and “Multiple Images” modes using the tabs.
  4. Remove Background:
  5. For single images, click the “Remove Background” button.
  6. For multiple images, click the “Process All Selected Images” button.
  7. Apply the Effect: Click the “Apply” button to apply the background removal effect to your selected image(s).
  8. Language Settings: Use the language selector to switch the plugin’s interface language.


Notes:

Ensure that the selected images are suitable for background removal for best results.


简介：

Removebg 背景擦除是一款功能强大且易于使用的 Figma 插件，旨在帮助您快速高效地去除图像背景。无论您是在处理单个图像还是多个图像，此插件都能让您只需一键即可清晰地隔离主体。


功能：

  1. 单张图片背景擦除：选择单张图片，一键即可去除背景。
  2. 多张图片背景擦除：选择多张图片，批量去除它们的背景。
  3. 多语言支持：插件支持多种语言，包括英语、简体中文、繁体中文、印地语、日语和韩语。
  4. 实时预览：在应用前查看背景擦除效果的预览。
  5. 轻松集成：无缝集成到您的 Figma 工作流程中。


使用说明：

  1. 安装插件：从 Figma 插件库中安装 Removebg 背景擦除插件。
  2. 选择图片：选择您要去除背景的图像。
  3. 选择模式：使用标签切换“单张图片”和“多张图片”模式。
  4. 去除背景：
  5. 对于单张图片，点击“去除背景”按钮。
  6. 对于多张图片，点击“处理所有选定的图片”按钮。
  7. 应用效果：点击“应用”按钮，将背景擦除效果应用到您选择的图像上。
  8. 语言设置：使用语言选择器切换插件的界面语言。


注意事项：

为获得最佳效果，请确保所选图像适合背景擦除。

accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.tagline: One-click background removal, simplifying your design workflow

plugins.name: Codia AI VectorMagic: Image to Full-Color Vector/PNG to SVG
plugins.description:
Transform your bitmap images into stunning, scalable vector graphics with the click of a button. Codia AI VectorMagic leverages advanced AI to offer a seamless transition from pixelated images to crisp, clean vectors. Perfect for designers, illustrators, and anyone looking to elevate their digital graphics.


How It Works


- PICK: Drag and drop any JPEG or PNG into the plugin. Starting with a pixel-based image, prepare to watch the magic happen.

- PROCESS: Our AI dives deep, converting your image into geometric shapes for flawless scalability. Say goodbye to blurs and hello to precision.

- DOWNLOAD: Preview the transformation, tweak if necessary, and download in SVG or PNG. Ready for any project.


Full Featured


- AI Vector Engine: Powered by the latest AI technology, combining deep learning with classical algorithms for unparalleled vectorization.

- Vector Graph: Unique computational geometry for automated edits and optimizations, achieving results beyond conventional methods.

- Full Shape Fitting & Curve Support: From Bezier curves to complex shapes, our technology ensures perfect fit and consistency.

- Clean Corners & High Performance: Meticulously crafted corners and high-speed processing for natural-looking vectors without waiting.

- Sub-Pixel Precision & Full Automation: Capturing the finest details automatically, requiring no manual input for a hassle-free experience.

- Versatile Image Types & Pre-Crop Feature: Ideal for logos, sketches, and even photographs. Maximize quality with smart cropping.

- Full Color & Transparency: Embrace the full spectrum of 32-bit color, including transparency for vibrant, true-to-life vectors.


Elevate your design workflow with Codia AI VectorMagic. Experience the future of vectorization today and bring unparalleled clarity and scalability to your digital art.


Call to Action☎️

For support issues: Slack Twitter Email Codia.AI

plugins.name: Auto Style Sheet
plugins.description:
When a style guide is missing, sifting through every design element can be time-consuming and challenging. This plugin not only aims to save significant time but also to pinpoint graphic design inconsistencies, ensuring a seamless and efficient transition from design to development.


How to Use:

  1. Select your intended Figma page.
  2. Go to Plugins > "Auto Style Sheet"
  3. Press 'Generate Report.'
  4. Examine the auto-generated list of styles and the highlighted inconsistencies.
  5. (Optional) Export your report for offline analysis or broader team sharing.


Key Features:

  1. Page-specific Reporting: The plugin exclusively scans the selected page, ensuring the report is tailored to your immediate needs.
  2. Automatic Detection: Swiftly identifies and lists all unique colors, fonts, and text sizes present on your chosen Figma page.
  3. Style Breakdown: Get a categorized view to quickly discern various text styles and colors.
  4. Visual Previews: Accompanied by a small visual snippet, each detected style ensures quick recognition and clarity of specific design elements.
  5. Exportable Reports: Extract the data in a handy format for offline consultation or team sharing.
  6. One-click Action: Generate the comprehensive report with a straightforward click, making the process simple.


Warnings:

  • The plugin exclusively scans the selected page.


Bugs? Feel free to contact us: tech@fri3nds.com

accepted.name: Fri3nds Team
accepted.description: Digital Solutions that blow you mind.

plugins.tagline: Scan your design and automatically provide you a style guide

plugins.name: Glyphy
plugins.description:
Create 3D anaglyphs from your layers! This plugin uses the order of your layers to apply a 3D effect. You can adjust the depth – how far "in" and "out" – using the slider.


You will need red/cyan Anaglyph glasses to see the result in 3D! You can buy pairs online or check in the back of 3d puzzle books or comics.


Tips

The plugin must be run on a single frame containing layers (each layer represents a depth in 3D)


Use your full screen and increase the brightness for the best possible effect.


If the effect doesn't look right, it might be too much depth - try reducing the depth with the sliders.


Fewer layers or groups will result in a more pronounced effect. If there's too many layers, you may not notice the effect (or it'll look really cool - depends on the content).


Due to the blend modes applied, masks and other advanced effects may not produce the result you expected - try flattening masks or turning off layer blend modes.


Extended use of the glasses can be jarring or even cause headaches. If the glasses make you feel uncomfortable at all, take them off immediately.


FAQ

The 3D effect looks backwards!

It's possible your layers are in reverse order (or maybe you have your glasses on backwards?) You can push the sliders to the opposite ends to reverse the effect.


Why is the width of the 3D image width a little smaller?

To create the 3D effect, layers must be moved to the right and left, this means a small portion of the edge of the image won't be in 3D - you can turn off clipping if you want to see the full image.


Next Release

  • Open source the code
  • Allow customization of colors
  • Stereograms for VR headsets and Cardboard

plugins.name: AutoGrid
plugins.description:
Grid support for Figma's AutoLayout! Define rows, columns and padding and let AutoGrid do the rest.

Find yourself constantly creating multiple AutoLayout layers just to keep your 24 cards in a neat layout?

With AutoGrid keeping your grids in sync is a breeze:
1) Select a root item for your grid (e.g. one single card or a selection of multiple cards)
2) Define your grid structure: How many rows, columns and padding should the new grid have?
3) Press "Create new grid".
-> AutoGrid will clone your root item (if you only selected one) or arrange your selection so it fills up the newly created grid (right now it won't duplicate items if you selected more than one).

Auto-Update:
With Auto-Update you dont have to manually update your grid any time your structure changes (e.g. you delete an item, you move items around, etc.).
Whenever a row has more columns than you specified in your grid structure the plugin will automatically rearrange your grid.

Motivation for this plugin:
I constantly found myself creating rows of items to make up a grid, and whenever I moved an item around I had to restructure it all, resulting in a lot of wasted time. Also I couldnt use Figma's Tidy Up feature as it doesnt allow me to specify columns or rows - plus when you delete or move an item the flow is broken.

Did you run into any issues or do you want to contribute?
This plugin is open sourced at https://github.com/six7/auto-grid

accepted.name: Jan Six
accepted.description:
Product Design @ GitHub

github.com/six7

plugins.name: Design System Generator
plugins.description:
Transform your design system with this plugin crafted to automate color and button creation and code generation in One-Click! Get instant generation of color design system and button components with properties and variants pre-built into the Figma design panel for your convenience! Get ready to use react code in a single click that directly integrates on your web apps.


Features:


  1. Color Selection: Pick from our palette or automatically match your design system's colors!
  2. Define Your Style: Adjust the radius, choose your font, and personalize your buttons.
  3. Smart Sizing: With adaptive sizing, padding and flexible dimensions, ensure your buttons are proportionate and legible across devices.
  4. Interactive Button Previews: Proof your work before generating buttons as components.
  5. Light & Dark Mode: Plugin interface adapts to your work environment.


  1. 1-Click to 48 Button Variants: Automatically generate 48 button variants with a single click, covering:
  2. Sizes: Small, medium, and large.
  3. Types: Primary, secondary, text, and elevated.
  4. States: Enabled, hovered, pressed, and disabled.


  1. Figma Integration: flexibility to tweak any button directly within the Figma inspect panel.
  2. Auto-Layout: Yes, all buttons are Figma-ready for seamless integration!
  3. Dynamic Color Variables/Styles: Now color variables/styles directly get linked to the button. No need to manually give color variable values.
  4. React Code: Development-Ready Exports to CSS and React code.
  5. Color Contrast Ratio Checks: Check color contrast ratio according to the WCAG guidelines.
  6. Color Design System Generator: From the Colors section in the plugin, you can create a color design system by providing a base color, specifying the number of complementary colors you want to generate, and selecting light or dark mode. With one click, you will get your color design system, complete with color variables, similar to Tailwind CSS.
  7. Edit Design Systems: Now you can edit the generated design systems by selecting the design system frame and opening the plugin from the right side panel in figma and clicking on edit design system.

Upcoming Features:


  1. AI-Powered Suggestions


Should you encounter any issues, have questions, or wish to share feedback, please contact us at support@aeroh.org. We are committed to supporting you and making your design process as efficient and productive as possible!

plugins.name: Find colors and Replace
plugins.description:
Simplify your design workflow with Find Colors and Replace 🌈, the powerful tool that helps you quickly find and replace colors.


This plugin allows you to effortlessly search for colors on your selected page, all pages in your project, or even a specific selection.


With the ability to review and select colors with just a few clicks, you can easily swap them out for your preferred hues. 


Say goodbye to the hassle of tedious color changes and hello to the convenience of Find colors and Replace by Refire Design! 🎨✨


📍 Plugin supports:

  • Entire project selection, page or several pages selection, and multiple or individual selections.
  • Fill types: fill, stroke, effects, and gradients.


🤔 How it works?

  • Install this plugin and run it inside your project.
  • Choose where the plugin should find colors.
  • Optional, choose color styles or skip them all.
  • Click on “Find colors”
  • Pick the color (or colors) you want to replace and select a new color (or colors) to take its place.
  • Voila 🪄

plugins.name: LottieToGIF
plugins.description:
LottieToGIF lets you seamlessly insert your Lottie .JSON animations as GIFs right into your canvas for prototyping without interrupting your workflow. 


You won't need an account and you won't need a subscription. It's a one-time fee of $10.00 for a lifetime license. 


  1. Timeline frame controller.
  2. Custom value backgrounds.
  3. Transparent background color (👑 Premium).
  4. Insert the selected frame as a SVG (👑 Premium) (✨ BETA)
  5. Upscale to larger GIF sizes to increase quality when resizing your GIFs in frames. 500x500 is the sweet spot (👑 Premium).
  6. Enable looping for GIFs in your prototypes (👑 Premium).
  7. Insert as an animated GIF.


⚡ Need support? Join us on Discord. We're excited to keep improving LottieToGIF and we're looking forward to your feedback as we continue to grow and scale. ⚡


FAQ:

1. Can I export my Lottie as a GIF outside of Figma?

LottieToGIF is designed to aid in your Figma prototyping, therefore it does not allow you to export GIFs, only insert them into your Figma canvas.


2. How long will the discounted rate be offered?

We're working on an update right now that adds WebM support, to give you even more control with your prototyping. With this, we'll be locking a few of our current free features behind Premium, and we'll be increasing the price when we release this update.


3. If I purchase LottieToGIF now, will I get the new features?

You sure will! If you purchase Premium, you'll automatically unlock access to features like Insert as Video.


4. Inserting as a SVG seems to be broken?

If your Lottie files are complex, you may run into issues with inserting as an SVG. We'd recommend simplifying your Lottie. We're still working to improve this functionality.

accepted.name: Seth Cottle
accepted.description:

👤 He/Him

plugins.tagline: Seamlessly convert your Lottie animations to GIFs without interrupting your workflow.

↳ This results in a much higher quality image and a significant improvement in 1200x1200 resolution performance.

• Play button now properly restarts the timeline! 🙈

• Automatic framerate scaling transforms high FPS Lottie files into crisp 30 FPS GIFs. 🎞️
↳ Not all GIF renderers support more than 50 FPS. So, if you had a 60 FPS Lottie, that would have previously result in a poor performing GIF—so we're handling it for you!
62609.tagline: Seamlessly convert your Lottie animations to GIFs without interrupting your workflow.

plugins.name: Smart Text Changer
plugins.description:
Bulk change / randomize text in real-time!


Features

  • Surface all texts in deeply nested layers.
  • Excellent text editing for both a single-page screen and a list.
  • Override or randomize subsets of your selection by 'Group by layer names'.
  • A range of dummy data and adding, such as names, addresses, years, numbers, cities, emails, balances, etc
  • Allow for your own random data input.
  • Instantly familiar UI to Sketch users.


Save your mouse 🐁 and say goodbye to frantically clicking to edit texts in Figma!


How:

  1. Choose anything with text inside it: texts, components, multiple objects, frames...
  2. Run the plugin to retrieve all text layers
  3. Take advantage of the ability to change, bulk edit, and randomize.
  4. Hit Refresh if you make a different selection.


Tips:

Name your text layer in main components will get you a more percise 'group by's.

plugins.name: Button Resizer
plugins.description:
Resize your button to fit its label width.

—————————————————————————————————
How to use:

Resize Button:
* Make sure your button label text layer is set to:
- Constraints: Left & Right
- Resizing: Fixed Size

1. Enter a text in your button label.
2. Select the button frame or component and run "Button Resizer > Resize Button"

Set Min Width:
You can set a minimum width on your button so that the plugin will never resize below it. If you are using a button component it is recommended to set this on the master component so all instances will inherit the minimum width automatically.

1. Select the button frame or component and run "Button Resizer > Set Min Width".
2. Enter a number and click Set.

plugins.name: Icon font generator
plugins.description:
Icon font generator For Figma

Easy to use from figma vectors, with it you will generate:

  • SVG
  • EOT
  • TrueType
  • Woff
  • Woff2
  • Symbol-defs SVG
  • each vector
  • json config


How it Works

This plugin detects all vectors selected. It then convert to fonts files, show a preview of result.


Basic Usage

  1. Select a vector.*
  2. click in "Generate Font" to download of zip with files.


*Note: unpredictable things can happen if you select more complex vectors.


More Configs

Font Parameters:

On the tab "Font Config" you can config some parameters from the font, including "Font Name", "Font Weight", "Font Style" ...*


*Note: That informations are save on the file.


Ligatures and Unicode:

Next to button "Generate Font" you choice if must have ligadures, and unicode is generated automatic.

For ligatures we use the name of files, but you can customizing both ligature and unicode.

In the vector name, we separede the props as follows:

{custom unicode}-{name}--{custom ligature}, so you custom parameters of icon.

For example: uEA01-iconName--customliga


Known issue, work in progress:

If your svg containts strokes or any tags besides a single path e.g polygon rect line etc, you will get errors when trying to convert them into fonts.

I'm working to correct the vector, before generating the fonts.
plugins.tagline: Icon font generator from figma vectors

plugins.name: CMYK Color Picker - (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, and Key, which is black)
plugins.description:
While RGB may rule the digital realm, CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, and Key, which is black) reigns supreme in the world of printing. It's not just a different language, it's a whole new way of thinking about color!


Imagine CMYK as a subtractive dance:


Start with white: Think of paper or canvas as a blank canvas, reflecting all the colors of the rainbow.

Add colored inks: Cyan, Magenta, and Yellow act like filters, absorbing specific wavelengths of light. So, mixing magenta and yellow doesn't create light green, it removes both red and blue, leaving what we perceive as green.

Black for depth: While mixing cyan, magenta, and yellow can create dark shades, true black is usually added separately to achieve richer, crisper details.

Why choose CMYK?


Printing fidelity: Unlike RGB, which relies on emitting colored light, CMYK inks physically interact with the printing surface, resulting in more accurate color representation on paper.

Richer dark tones: Mixing CMY inks can create muddy blacks, but adding dedicated black ink ensures deep, vibrant shadows and details.

Industry standard: From magazines to posters, CMYK is the language of professional printing, guaranteeing consistent results across different printers and materials.

But here's the catch:


Less intuitive: Unlike RGB, where colors mix additively like light, CMYK's subtractive nature can be counterintuitive, especially for beginners. Black can make colors dull, and achieving specific shades requires understanding how inks interact.

Color matching can be tricky: Predicting the final printed color from a digital CMYK preview isn't as straightforward as with RGB. Calibration and printing profiles play a crucial role in color accuracy.

Who's CMYK for?


Printers and graphic designers: If your work ends up on paper, CMYK is your essential tool for achieving vivid and accurate printed colors.

Professionals working with physical materials: From packaging designers to textile artists, understanding CMYK is crucial for color consistency in tangible creations.

Color enthusiasts: If you want to delve deeper into the science and art of color printing, CMYK offers a fascinating world to explore.

So, CMYK is not just a color picker, it's a gateway to a whole new chapter in the world of color. Embrace its unique logic, and you'll be printing masterpieces in no time!


Remember, CMYK is all about understanding how inks interact to create vibrant, tangible colors. It's a different journey than RGB, but just as rewarding when you master its dance!
